org.apache.flink.api.java.record.io

Class ExternalProcessFixedLengthInputFormat<T extends ExternalProcessInputSplit>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.flink.api.common.io.GenericInputFormat<Record>
      • org.apache.flink.api.java.record.io.GenericInputFormat
        • org.apache.flink.api.java.record.io.ExternalProcessInputFormat<T>
          • org.apache.flink.api.java.record.io.ExternalProcessFixedLengthInputFormat<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of the input split (must extend ExternalProcessInputSplit)
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, InputFormat<Record,GenericInputSplit>, InputSplitSource<GenericInputSplit>

    public abstract class ExternalProcessFixedLengthInputFormat<T extends ExternalProcessInputSplit>
extends ExternalProcessInputFormat<T>
    This input format starts an external process and reads its input from the standard out (stdout) of the started process. The input is split into fixed-sized segments from which a Record is generated. The external process is started outside of the JVM via a provided start command and can be an arbitrary program, e.g., a data generator or a shell script. The input format checks the exit code of the process to validate whether the process terminated correctly. A list of allowed exit codes can be provided. The input format requires (ExternalProcessInputSplit objects that hold the command to execute. Warning: This format does not consume the standard error stream (stderr) of the started process. This might cause deadlocks.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • readBytes

        public abstract boolean readBytes(Record target,
                byte[] buffer,
                int startPos)
        Reads a record out of the given buffer. This operation always consumes the standard number of bytes, regardless of whether the produced record was valid.
        Parameters:
        target - The target Record
        buffer - The buffer containing the binary data.
        startPos - The start position in the byte array.
        Returns:
        True, is the record is valid, false otherwise.

      • configure

        public void configure(Configuration parameters)
        Description copied from interface: InputFormat
        Configures this input format. Since input formats are instantiated generically and hence parameterless, this method is the place where the input formats set their basic fields based on configuration values.

        This method is always called first on a newly instantiated input format.

        Specified by:
        configure in interface InputFormat<Record,GenericInputSplit>
        Overrides:
        configure in class ExternalProcessInputFormat<T extends ExternalProcessInputSplit>
        Parameters:
        parameters - The configuration with all parameters.

      • setTargetReadBufferSize

        public void setTargetReadBufferSize(int targetReadBufferSize)
        Sets the target size of the buffer to be used to read from the stdout stream. The actual size depends on the record length since it is chosen such that records are not split. This method has only an effect, if it is called before the input format is opened.
        Parameters:
        targetReadBufferSize - The target size of the read buffer.

      • open

        public void open(GenericInputSplit split)
          throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: InputFormat
        Opens a parallel instance of the input format to work on a split.

        When this method is called, the input format it guaranteed to be configured.

        Specified by:
        open in interface InputFormat<Record,GenericInputSplit>
        Overrides:
        open in class ExternalProcessInputFormat<T extends ExternalProcessInputSplit>
        Parameters:
        split - The split to be opened.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown, if the spit could not be opened due to an I/O problem.

      • reachedEnd

        public boolean reachedEnd()
                   throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: InputFormat
        Method used to check if the end of the input is reached.

        When this method is called, the input format it guaranteed to be opened.

        Returns:
        True if the end is reached, otherwise false.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown, if an I/O error occurred.

      • nextRecord

        public Record nextRecord(Record reuse)
                  throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: InputFormat
        Tries to read the next pair from the input. By using the return value invalid records in the input can be skipped.

        When this method is called, the input format it guaranteed to be opened.

        Parameters:
        reuse - Object that may be reused.
        Returns:
        Indicates whether the record could be successfully read. A return value of true indicates that the read was successful, a return value of false indicates that the current record was not read successfully and should be skipped.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown, if an I/O error occurred.
